item.title: 马士基船东出价 8.4 亿美元收购瑞典 Concentric 公司
item.description: A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S 的控制家族同意以约 85.9 亿克朗（8.4 亿美元）的价格收购一家瑞典发动机产品制造商，将其在集装箱运价上涨期间获得的部分意外利润用于收购。【原文：The family controlling A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S agreed to buy a Swedish maker of engine products for about 8.59 billion kronor ($840 million), spending some of the windfall profits it made during the container rate boom.】

item.title: 报道称新世界以 12 亿美元收购香港购物中心
item.description: 据当地媒体《星岛日报》报道，新世界发展有限公司收到了一家中国国有企业以 90 亿港元（12 亿美元）竞购香港一家购物中心的出价。【原文：New World Development Co. received a HK$9 billion ($1.2 billion) bid for a Hong Kong shopping mall from a Chinese state-owned company, according to local media Sing Tao.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将降息，西班牙通胀降至一年低点
item.description: 西班牙通胀率降至一年来的最低水平，欧元区各国的通胀率也可能随之回落，从而使欧洲中央银行得以继续降低利率。【原文：Spanish inflation eased to its lowest level in a year — a retreat that’s likely to be mirrored across the euro zone, allowing the European Central Bank to continue lowering interest rates.】

item.title: 瑞士资产管理公司 GAM 将在迈阿密设立办事处，拓展美国业务
item.description: 瑞士资产管理公司 GAM Holding AG 将在美国迈阿密金融区开设第二个办事处，从而扩大其在美国的业务。【原文：Swiss asset manager GAM Holding AG is enlarging its presence in the US by opening a second office in the country, in the financial district of Miami.】

item.title: 土耳其股市八月跌幅全球最大
item.description: 在全球股市飙升至几乎历史新高的一个月里，土耳其的表现令人沮丧，因为高利率和通货膨胀共同侵蚀着企业利润。【原文：In a month that saw global stocks roar back to almost all-time highs, Turkey stands out for its dismal performance as the combination of high interest rates and inflation erodes corporate profits.】

item.title: 全球资金回流，马来西亚股市逼近四年高点
item.description: 随着东南亚国家的政治稳定和对人工智能投资的青睐开始见效，马来西亚股市的涨势有望延续。【原文：The rally in Malaysian equities is poised to extend as the Southeast Asian country’s political stability and wooing of artificial intelligence investments begin to pay off.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数有望避开与英伟达相关的跌势
item.description: 在台北展出的 Nvidia Cop.在台北展出的 HGX B100 GPU 服务器。摄影师：Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg【原文：An Nvidia Cop. HGX B100 GPU server on display in Taipei. Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg】

item.title: 保乐称本季度美国和中国销售仍将疲软
item.description: 保乐力加集团（Pernod Ricard SA）旗下品牌包括绝对伏特加（Absolut Vodka）和马爹利干邑（Martell Cognac），该集团表示，由于美国的去库存化和中国疲软的消费支出抑制了需求，本季度销售仍将疲软。【原文：Pernod Ricard SA, whose brands include Absolut Vodka and Martell Cognac, said sales would remain soft this quarter as destocking in the US and weak consumer spending in China curb demand.】

item.title: 新加坡-柔佛经济协议签署时间推迟至 11 月
item.description: 据一位高级官员透露，新加坡和马来西亚之间关于在柔佛州建立经济特区的协议有可能在 11 月签署。【原文：A deal between Singapore and Malaysia to establish a special economic zone in Johor is likely to be signed by November, according to a top official.】

item.title: 韩国为贷款人清理房地产贷款设定了严格期限
item.description: 韩国金融市场监管机构已要求面临房地产项目融资贷款问题的贷款机构在 9 月 6 日之前完成清理计划，在风险贷款增长超过监管机构之前的估计之后，该机构设定了一个紧迫的最后期限。【原文：South Korea’s financial market regulator has asked lenders with exposure to troubled real estate project finance loans to finalize their cleanup plans by Sept. 6, setting a tight deadline after growth in risky loans exceeded the regulator’s previous estimates.】

item.title: 新加坡交易所资本市场部主管宋志平即将离职
item.description: 新加坡交易所资本市场主管马修-宋（Matthew Song）即将离职。【原文：Singapore Exchange Ltd.’s head of capital markets, Matthew Song, is departing from the bourse, about a year after he took on the role following a revamp, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 当 50% 的利润率不再令人印象深刻时，你就是 Nvidia
item.description:
人工智能的狂热 可能最终达到了顶峰，这使得利润率不断上升变得不切实际。另外：伯克希尔加入 1 万亿美元俱乐部。【原文：

AI frenzy may have finally peaked, making ever rising profitability unrealistic. Also: Berkshire joins the $1 trillion club.

item.title: 德国电动汽车需求骤减，欧洲汽车销量停滞不前
item.description: 由于该地区最大的汽车市场德国对电动汽车的需求进一步减弱，7 月份欧洲汽车销量基本持平。【原文：Auto sales in Europe were roughly flat in July as demand for electric vehicles weakened further in Germany, the region’s biggest car market.】

item.title: 泰国顶级工业园区开发商预计将出售更多土地
item.description: 泰国最大的工业地产开发商 WHA 公司预计，下半年外国制造商和公司的需求上升将引发土地销售激增。【原文：WHA Corp., Thailand’s largest industrial estate developer, expects rising demand from foreign manufacturers and companies to trigger a surge in land sales in the second half of the year.】

item.title: 菲律宾希望提高债券流动性以吸引全球资金
item.description: 据一位高级官员透露，菲律宾正在寻求改善其国内政府债券市场的流动性，以使其债务对全球基金更具吸引力。【原文：The Philippines is looking to improve liquidity in its domestic government bond market, according to a top official, to make its debt more attractive to global funds.】

item.title: 中国人民银行的新债券交易网页引发对即将采取的行动的押注
item.description: 中国央行在其网站上为其债券交易业务创建了一个新栏目，这激起了人们对其可能很快开始买卖主权债务的猜测。【原文：China’s central bank created a new section for its bond trading operations on its website, stoking speculation it may soon start buying or selling sovereign debt.】

item.title: 日本基金将购买 2007 年以来最多的外国债券
item.description: 由于海外货币政策的前景刺激了债务反弹和货币对冲成本下降，日本投资者将在本月购买 17 年来最大数量的外国债券。【原文：Japanese investors are set this month to buy the largest amount of foreign bonds in 17 years as the prospects for overseas monetary policies spur a rally in debt and a drop in currency hedging costs.】

item.title: 铝领跌基本金属，供需平衡黯淡无光
item.description: 铝从两个月高位回落，原因是对中国需求复苏力度的担忧挥之不去，供应依然充足。其他工业金属也出现下跌。【原文：Aluminum extended its retreat from a two-month high as concerns over the strength of China’s demand recovery lingered, with supplies remaining sufficient. Other industrial metals also declined.】

item.title: Cbus 董事在澳大利亚建筑工会丑闻中离职
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老金公司之一 Cbus 的三名董事已离开由 14 人组成的董事会，因为该基金面临着监管机构要求对其与一家建筑工会的密切关系进行审查。【原文：Three directors of Cbus, one of Australia’s biggest pensions, have left its 14-strong board as the fund faces a regulator-mandated review about its close ties to a construction union.】

item.title: 美国管道运营商 ONEOK 签订两笔交易，总价达 59 亿美元
item.description: 美国输油管运营商 ONEOK 公司同意收购二叠纪盆地的一家竞争对手和另一家公司的控股权，两笔交易总价值达 59 亿美元。【原文：US pipeline operator ONEOK Inc. agreed to buy a Permian Basin rival and a controlling stake in another company in two transactions valued at a combined $5.9 billion.】

item.title: 英伟达预测令人工智能反弹前景黯淡，美股期货下跌
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.）发布的营收预期低于分析师的最高预期，加剧了市场对人工智能热潮能否持续的担忧，美股期货随之下滑。【原文：US stock futures slid after Nvidia Corp. gave a revenue forecast that fell short of the highest analyst estimates, fueling concerns over the sustainability of the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 技术面与库存和利比亚争夺市场，石油维持两日跌势
item.description: 由于技术障碍阻碍了美国库存下降和利比亚生产中断带来的涨幅，石油在连续两日下跌后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after a two-day drop, as technical barriers stymied gains from a decline in US stockpiles and disruptions to Libyan production.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。英伟达（Nvidia）营收超预期但低于最高预期，中国经济增长前景被下调，新兴市场债券反弹。【原文：Good morning. Nvidia’s revenue beats estimates but falls short of the highest forecasts, China’s growth outlook gets cut and emerging-market bonds stage a rebound. — Kristine Aquino】

item.title: 卢拉的航空公司救援计划获巴西下议院批准
item.description: 巴西立法者批准了一项期待已久的航空业财政援助计划，预计将为陷入困境的航空公司提供 50 亿雷亚尔（约合 9.14 亿美元）的信贷。【原文：Brazilian lawmakers approved a long-awaited financial aid plan for the airline sector that is expected to provide 5 billion reais ($914 million) in credit for troubled carriers.】

item.title: 英伟达令人失望，亚洲股市将下滑：市场综述
item.description: 在英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）令人失望的财报打压了科技股的前景之后，亚洲股市周四将追随美国股市走低。【原文：Stocks in Asia are poised to track their US peers lower on Thursday after underwhelming earnings from Nvidia Corp. dampened the outlook for tech stocks.】

item.title: 澳航为声誉受损付出代价
item.description: 早上好，我是乔治，我在悉尼为您播报今早的头条新闻。今日必读：- 澳大利亚通胀降温，但降温速度不够快- 澳洲航空利润下滑- 英伟达股价下跌，因营收预期不佳【原文：Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney with this morning’s top news for you.Today’s must-reads:• Australian inflation cools, but not fast enough• Qantas profit dips• Nvidia shares fall as revenue forecast underwhelms】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构计划对私人信贷风险进行压力测试
item.description: 澳大利亚银行业监管机构计划对本国金融部门进行压力测试，以进一步了解私人信贷资金流动对其他市场部门的影响。【原文：Australia’s banking regulator plans to stress test the nation’s financial sector to shed more light on the impact of private credit capital flows on other market segments.】

item.title: 销售下滑，Big Lots 考虑申请破产
item.description: 据知情人士透露，非价格家居用品零售商大乐购公司（Big Lots Inc.【原文：Off-price home goods retailer Big Lots Inc. is contemplating a potential bankruptcy filing after years of sales declines, according to people with knowledge of the plans.】

item.title: 造船商奥斯塔尔支持美国证券交易委员会对其股东进行处罚
item.description: 奥斯特有限公司（Austal Ltd.）表示，该公司支持美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）的一项计划，即向那些 "能够证明自己因 "为美国海军造船夸大收益的会计计划而 "蒙受损失 "的股东发放该公司被处以的 2400 万美元罚金。【原文：Austal Ltd. said it supports a plan by the Securities and Exchange Commission to distribute a $24 million penalty it’s been hit with to shareholders “who could show they suffered” a loss as a result of an accounting scheme designed to inflate earnings from its shipbuilding for the US Navy.】
